course.title: Reason and Faith in the West
course.meeting_text: M., W., (F.), at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: Examines from an historical perspective one of the central themes in the Western intellectual tradition: the desire to reconcile rational philosophy with religious and biblical authority. Discusses the transformations in conceptions of reason, science, biblical interpretation, and divine intervention (among other themes) in the context of the long period of change from medieval to modern. Readings emphasize primary sources-including, for example, Augustine, Aquinas, Galileo, Descartes, Newton, and Darwin.
course.notes: This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
